prompt:
I want you to solve planning problems. Here is the domain PDDL file: 
 (define (domain blocksworld-4ops)
  (:requirements :strips)
(:predicates (clear ?x)
             (on-table ?x)
             (arm-empty)
             (holding ?x)
             (on ?x ?y))

(:action pickup
  :parameters (?ob)
  :precondition (and (clear ?ob) (on-table ?ob) (arm-empty))
  :effect (and (holding ?ob) (not (clear ?ob)) (not (on-table ?ob)) 
               (not (arm-empty))))

(:action putdown
  :parameters  (?ob)
  :precondition (holding ?ob)
  :effect (and (clear ?ob) (arm-empty) (on-table ?ob) 
               (not (holding ?ob))))

(:action stack
  :parameters  (?ob ?underob)
  :precondition (and (clear ?underob) (holding ?ob))
  :effect (and (arm-empty) (clear ?ob) (on ?ob ?underob)
               (not (clear ?underob)) (not (holding ?ob))))

(:action unstack
  :parameters  (?ob ?underob)
  :precondition (and (on ?ob ?underob) (clear ?ob) (arm-empty))
  :effect (and (holding ?ob) (clear ?underob)
               (not (on ?ob ?underob)) (not (clear ?ob)) (not (arm-empty))))) 
An example planning problem is: 
 You have 5 blocks. 
b2 is on top of b5. 
b5 is on top of b1. 
b1 is on top of b4. 
b3 is on top of b2. 
b4 is on the table. 
b3 is clear. 
Your arm is empty. 
Your goal is to move the blocks. 
b4 should be on top of b3. 
The problem PDDL file to this problem is: 
 (define (problem BW-rand-5)
(:domain blocksworld-4ops)
(:objects b1 b2 b3 b4 b5 )
(:init
(arm-empty)
(on b1 b4)
(on b2 b5)
(on b3 b2)
(on-table b4)
(on b5 b1)
(clear b3)
)
(:goal
(and
(on b4 b3))
)
) 
Now I have a new planning problem and its description is: 
 You have 9 blocks. 
b5 is on top of b2. 
b2 is on top of b3. 
b3 is on top of b1. 
b8 is on top of b6. 
b1 is on top of b4. 
b6 is on top of b9. 
b9 is on top of b5. 
b4 is on the table. 
b7 is on the table. 
b7 is clear. 
b8 is clear. 
Your arm is empty. 
Your goal is to move the blocks. 
b2 should be on top of b5. 
b3 should be on top of b1. 
b4 should be on top of b8. 
b5 should be on top of b3. 
b6 should be on top of b4. 
b8 should be on top of b7. 
b9 should be on top of b2. 
Provide me with BOTH a domain PDDL file AND a problem PDDL file that describes the new planning problem. Format your response as follows:
DOMAIN:
[domain PDDL content]

PROBLEM:
[problem PDDL content]

Make sure both files use consistent naming and types. Do not provide any other explanations.
llm_response:
DOMAIN:
```
(define (domain blocksworld-9blocks)
  (:requirements :strips)
  (:predicates (clear ?x)
             (on-table ?x)
             (arm-empty)
             (holding ?x)
             (on ?x ?y))

  (:action pickup
    :parameters (?ob)
    :precondition (and (clear ?ob) (on-table ?ob) (arm-empty))
    :effect (and (holding ?ob) (not (clear ?ob)) (not (on-table ?ob)) 
                 (not (arm-empty))))

  (:action putdown
    :parameters (?ob)
    :precondition (holding ?ob)
    :effect (and (clear ?ob) (arm-empty) (on-table ?ob) 
                 (not (holding ?ob))))

  (:action stack
    :parameters (?ob ?underob)
    :precondition (and (clear ?underob) (holding ?ob))
    :effect (and (arm-empty) (clear ?ob) (on ?ob ?underob)
                 (not (clear ?underob)) (not (holding ?ob))))

  (:action unstack
    :parameters (?ob ?underob)
    :precondition (and (on ?ob ?underob) (clear ?ob) (arm-empty))
    :effect (and (holding ?ob) (clear ?underob)
                 (not (on ?ob ?underob)) (not (clear ?ob)) (not (arm-empty))))
)
```

PROBLEM:
```
(define (problem BW-9blocks-problem)
(:domain blocksworld-9blocks)
(:objects b1 b2 b3 b4 b5 b6 b7 b8 b9)
(:init
(arm-empty)
(on b5 b2)
(on b2 b3)
(on b3 b1)
(on b8 b6)
(on b1 b4)
(on b6 b9)
(on b9 b5)
(on-table b4)
(on-table b7)
(clear b7)
(clear b8)
)
(:goal
(and
(on b2 b5)
(on b3 b1)
(on b4 b8)
(on b5 b3)
(on b6 b4)
(on b8 b7)
(on b9 b2)
)
)
)
```
generated_problem_pddl:
(define (problem BW-9blocks-problem)
(:domain blocksworld-9blocks)
(:objects b1 b2 b3 b4 b5 b6 b7 b8 b9)
(:init
(arm-empty)
(on b5 b2)
(on b2 b3)
(on b3 b1)
(on b8 b6)
(on b1 b4)
(on b6 b9)
(on b9 b5)
(on-table b4)
(on-table b7)
(clear b7)
(clear b8)
)
(:goal
(and
(on b2 b5)
(on b3 b1)
(on b4 b8)
(on b5 b3)
(on b6 b4)
(on b8 b7)
(on b9 b2)
)
)
)
